meanings.definition: Causing or tending to cause sleep.
meanings.sent1: The boring lecture had a soporific effect on the students.
meanings.sent2: The sound of rain on the roof was soporific, lulling me into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent3: The soporific rhythm of the rocking chair put the baby to sleep in no time.
meanings.sent4: The soporific nature of the music enveloped the room like a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The soporific scent of lavender filled the room, inviting a deep rest.
